title: Avraham Taviv
text:
Avraham Taviv (, born 1889, died 20 April 1950) was an Israeli politician.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Yemen%20Vilayet">Yemen Vilayet</a> in the <a href="Ottoman%20Empire">Ottoman Empire</a>, Taviv received a religious Jewish education, before working as a jeweler and repairing weapons. He made <a href="aliyah">aliyah</a> to Ottoman-controlled Palestine in 1908 in the first caravan from Yemen. He joined <a href="Hapoel%20Hatzair">Hapoel Hatzair</a> and later <a href="Ahdut%20HaAvoda">Ahdut HaAvoda</a>. In 1918 he was elected to <a href="Rishon%20LeZion">Rishon LeZion</a>'s village council. An activist for Yemenite immigrants, he helped establish four Yemenite neighbourhoods in various cities and towns, and was the Yemenite settlements' representative on the <a href="Jewish%20Agency%20for%20Israel">Jewish Agency</a>'s Aliyah Committee.
In 1920 he attended the founding convention of the <a href="Histadrut">Histadrut</a> trade union (and was later elected to its Agricultural Association), and in the same year he was elected to the first <a href="Assembly%20of%20Representatives%20%28Mandate%20Palestine%29">Assembly of Representatives</a>. He served on the <a href="Jewish%20National%20Council">Jewish National Council</a> until 1931, and again from 1944 until 1948. In 1923 he established the <a href="Yemenite%20Association">Yemenite Association</a>, which he led until his death. In 1945 he joined <a href="Mapai">Mapai</a>, and was elected to the first Knesset on its list in <a href="1949%20Israeli%20legislative%20election">1949</a>. He died on 20 April 1950, and was replaced by <a href="Yitzhak%20Kanav">Yitzhak Kanav</a>.
